text: Determines a facing angle.

Determines the movement direction. Among the values it can take:
* -1: the entity moves up.
* -2: the entity moves down.
Individual control of pitch, yaw and roll.
Individual control of pitch and yaw.. Allows rotation in directions different from roll.
constantLight color of the md3 model included with the entity. It doesn't affect entity brushes.
Amount of ammo given to the player on pickup.
Amount of game seconds of duration of this powerup.

If set between 0-7, the location will be displayed with one of eight colors:
- 0: white
- 1: red
- 2: green
- 3: yellow
- 4: blue
- 5: cyan
- 6: magenta
- 7: white
Number of points to add.
Damage to inflict when blocking the operation of the entity.
If set, the entity will ONLY appear in these gametypes. (See Notes)
If set, the entity will NOT appear in these gametypes. (See Notes)
If set, in order to activate, the entity must take damage instead of being touched.
Total height of movement, defaults to model height.
Amount of travel of the oscillation movement.
constantLight radius of the model included with the entity. It doesn't affect entity brushes.
Protrusion above rest position after the end of the movement.
Text to display.
Gives the point a name which is displayed in-game. (MAX length: 19 chars)
Name of the location.
.md3 model to draw.
Wav file to play. Recommended use is for looping sounds.
If set to 1, a bot will never attempt to pick up this item.
Prevents bots from using this spot as a spawnpoint.
If set to 1, this entity won't spawn in free-for-all gamemodes.
Prevents humans from using this spot as a spawnpoint.
If set to 1, this entity won't spawn in single-player mode.
If set to 1, this entity won't spawn in team-based gamemodes.
Alternate method of setting the entity's origin point. Use it if you don't use an origin brush in the entity. (See notes)
Start offset of the oscillation cycle. Values are located in the range (0,1); any integer value different to 1 equals to no offset.
Start offset of the swinging cycle. Values are located in the range (0,1); any integer value different to 1 equals to no offset.
Radius of a spotlight at the target point.
Variation of time between respawns. The value is both added and subtracted from \"wait\".
Wait variance. The time between firing is located in the range [wait - random,wait + random].
Number of degrees of deviance from the target.
Delay variance, total delay = delay +/- random seconds.
Wait variance. The time between firing is located in the range [wait - random,wait + random].
Angle modifier to orient the camera around the target vector.
Scaling factor. Recommended values sit between 50 and 300.
Speed of entity movement.
Seconds to complete a bob cycle.
Number of degrees each way the pendulum swings.
Determines how fast it moves.
Speed to move to the next corner.
All entities with a matching targetname will be used.
The entity which is targetted at for projection.
Next path corner.
Picking up the item will trigger these targets.
Next path corner and other targets to fire.
If set, the door needs to be operated by a func_button or trigger.
A target_give entity can point at this item so its given to the player.
Shader to be swapped out for triggerable shader entities. (See Notes)
Shader to be swapped in for triggerable shader entities. (See Notes)
If set, the entity is teamed up with items in this team. (See Notes)
Separate func_door entities within this team will operate together.

Seconds before the item respawns again.
-1 = never respawns again.

Seconds between triggerings.
* -1 = never returns.

Seconds before the door returns to its default state.
* -1 = returns immediately.
Base time between triggering all targets.
Seconds to wait before behining move to next corner.
Seconds to pause before firing targets.

Seconds between auto triggerings.
* 0 = doesn't auto trigger.
Path of the art file used to guide the mapping of textures on the terrain surface.
Number of unique root shaders that will be used on the terrain surface.
Metashader used to assign textures to the terrain entity.
Light attenuation scaling. Lower values lessens angle attenuation, while higher values give sharper, more faceted lighting.

Per-entity control over shadow casting. The values it can take are:
* < -1: Cast shadows on entities with _rs or _receiveshadows but NOT in the world.
* -1: Doesn't cast shadows on the world.
* 0: Casts shadows on entities. (Default)
* 1: Casts shadows on the world. (Also default)
* > 1: Casts shadows on entities with _rs or _receiveshadows AND in the world.
Cel shader used for this geometry.
Distance in world units for spotlights and targetted lights. Also the degree for sunlights. (Recommended values between 0.5 and 3)
If set to 1, toggles on lightmap filtering.
Lightmaps within this amount of world units will be filtered.
Scales the resolution of lightmaps on brushes and patches in the entity.

Per-entity control over shadow reception. The values it can take are:
* 0: Doesn't receive shadows.
* Range (0,1): Receive shadows from both entities with _cs or _castshadows and world.
* 1: Receive shadows on everything (world shadows). This is the default value.
* > 1: Receive shadows ONLY from entities with _cs or _castshadows.
Random jitters distributed over the solid arc. (~16)
The model attached to the entity.
Worldspawn light style. Values are set in the range [1;31].
AlphaGen value for the light style index 1. Values takes standard shader waveform functions (e.g. wave sin 0.5 0.3 0.25 1.5).
rgbGen value for the light style index 1. Values takes standard shader waveform functions (e.g. wave sin 0.5 0.3 0.25 1.5).
